answers.answer: Hello,Loss of sensation of the area after laser treatment is not a common side effect and is very less likely. I suggest you to consult a doctor and get other causes of loss of sensations ruled out. Such loss of sensation are common in alcoholics and metabolic disorders like diabetes, hypothyroidism, and hypoparathyroidismThey can also be due to peripheral vascular disease, vitamin B12 deficiency or malnutrition.Get your blood sugar and thyroid hormones levels evaluated. You can take some vit B12 for some days and see if the tingling is gone or not.In case the symptoms persist then please consult a neurologist as it can be due to some neurological disorder. It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your dermatologist. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: a friend told me that after she got laser hair removal for the pubic area she had lost her feeling in that area , and couldnt enjoy her sexual life anymore , could that be one of the side effects?Thanks
title: lazer treatment and loss of sensation
